abstracts.cdata!:
The Northwest Selangor Integrated
            Agricultural Development Project will improve the
            productivity and incomes of 32,000 smallholder families in
            northwest Selangor (of whom the overwhelming majority are
            below the relative proverty line and 65% of whom have
            incomes below the absolute poverty line), through the
            provision of improved drainage and irrigation facilities,
            access roads, training and intensified agricultural
            supporting services; it will also improve the regional
            drainage systems with subsequent subsidiary benefits for the
            region's towns and estates. The major risk associated
            with the project involves the uncertainties associated with
            the implementation of the integrated agricultural support
            services system.
